Articles.Content:
Can anyone please tell me what the status is of the american pack and 0.23.5? The latest version I can find is 1.2.

UPDATE: Well I installed this with 0.23.5 and with FAS (Ferram Aerospace) the Ares I was nearly impossible to get to orbit without going straight up until over 39km where the atmospheric pressure drops to almost zero. If you try to turn it before then it just rips itself apart as the SRB is full-on and is exceeding terminal velocity before it even gets to 2km! Either the booster stats need to be dialed back or I need someone to explain the proper lfight profile with this craft when used in conjunction with FAS.

Edited May 17, 2014 by ctbram

You think bobcat will create a proper SLS and add it to the American pack instead of the jury rigged ones you can create with mods and stock parts? Or just overhaul the Aries and Altair? Meaning a huge sls with the srbs from the American pack, and engines and tanks to scale.

Like this...

http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/9/9d/SLS_configurations.png

I'd like to see that too, but making a "proper" SLS right now might be tricky. Neither the upper stage nor booster specs are settled. It appears NASA is considering several upper/earth departure stages, and will likely use different ones depending on payload and mission. For SLS Block II, NASA has begun the Advanced Booster Competition that is expected to end in 2015, the candidates being a new Advanced SRB, a liquid booster with an american version of the NK-33, and a liquid booster with two modernized F-1 engines (from the Saturn V). The Block I that will launch the unmanned lunar fly-by in 2017 will use the normal SRBs and a "modified Delta Cryogenic Second Stage". After that, it's all in the air.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Space_Launch_System

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Delta_Cryogenic_Second_Stage

So BobCat has some difficult choices when updating the American Pack. For one the Ares rockets have been canceled, and so has the Altair lander. The Orion Service Module has changed (at least the solar panels). I'd consider renaming the current pack as the Ares Pack or Constellation Pack and keep it as sort of a legacy pack moving forward.

I'd like to see that too, but making a "proper" SLS right now might be tricky. Neither the upper stage nor booster specs are settled. It appears NASA is considering several upper/earth departure stages, and will likely use different ones depending on payload and mission. For SLS Block II, NASA has begun the Advanced Booster Competition that is expected to end in 2015, the candidates being a new Advanced SRB, a liquid booster with an american version of the NK-33, and a liquid booster with two modernized F-1 engines (from the Saturn V). The Block I that will launch the unmanned lunar fly-by in 2017 will use the normal SRBs and a "modified Delta Cryogenic Second Stage". After that, it's all in the air.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Space_Launch_System

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Delta_Cryogenic_Second_Stage

So BobCat has some difficult choices when updating the American Pack. For one the Ares rockets have been canceled, and so has the Altair lander. The Orion Service Module has changed (at least the solar panels). I'd consider renaming the current pack as the Ares Pack or Constellation Pack and keep it as sort of a legacy pack moving forward.

I agree with everything. It should become a legacy pack because the parts are awesome, its just that they aren't going to be used. I did jury rig an SLS though with SDHI, Aerojet/Kerbodyne, and the American SRBS. Its wildly overpowered. I made it to an encounter with Jool and back.

@sp1998

Here's my attempt. Stock capsule, SM and LES. Stock Kerbodyne first stage, except for SRB nose cones from KW. The second stage is a J2 Engine Mounting Plate and matching decoupler/engine faring from FASA, BobCat's J-2X engine (FASA's J-2 is too weak, but can also work), some round RCS tanks, white kerbodyne tank (half full for balance) and a tank/adapter from KW Rocketry (empty). Has enough DeltaV for a Mun fly-by like the SLS Block 1. A little more fuel and it can orbit the Mun and come back.

And here's a similar rocket, but with BobCat's Orion, CM and LES.

Edited May 17, 2014 by BioHaZarD.PT

@sp1998

Here's my attempt. Stock capsule, SM and LES. Stock Kerbodyne first stage, except for SRB nose cones from KW. The second stage is a J2 Engine Mounting Plate and matching decoupler/engine faring from FASA, BobCat's J-2X engine (FASA's J-2 is too weak, but can also work), some round RCS tanks, white kerbodyne tank (half full for balance) and a tank/adapter from KW Rocketry (empty). Has enough DeltaV for a Mun fly-by like the SLS Block 1. A little more fuel and it can orbit the Mun and come back.

http://imgur.com/xkaUSZ0.jpg

And here's a similar rocket, but with BobCat's Orion, CM and LES.

http://i.imgur.com/mA5QBbL.jpg

Nice!! The only reason I didn't use Bobcats Orion and LES is because his parts don't line up with anything.
Also I have RPM installed and all of the IVAs are blank? RPM says it works with American Pack but I still don't have IVAs
Eeeh, guys, Bobcat has denied making an SLS. It was a long, LONG time ago, but he said that he did not want to make it.

Eeeh, guys, Bobcat has denied making an SLS. It was a long, LONG time ago, but he said that he did not want to make it.

Maybe he has changed his mind?..............unlikely.

Can anyone please tell me what the status is of the american pack and 0.23.5? The latest version I can find is 1.2.

UPDATE: Well I installed this with 0.23.5 and with FAS (Ferram Aerospace) the Ares I was nearly impossible to get to orbit without going straight up until over 39km where the atmospheric pressure drops to almost zero. If you try to turn it before then it just rips itself apart as the SRB is full-on and is exceeding terminal velocity before it even gets to 2km! Either the booster stats need to be dialed back or I need someone to explain the proper lfight profile with this craft when used in conjunction with FAS.

I haven't tried Ferram yet, but you can try reducing the thrust of the SRB (right click on it inside the assembly building). I'd suggest trying to set it so the thrust-to-weight ratio is 1.40.

I haven't tried Ferram yet, but you can try reducing the thrust of the SRB (right click on it inside the assembly building). I'd suggest trying to set it so the thrust-to-weight ratio is 1.40.

Try this it's called Engine Thrust Control it's required for the CSS and it helps regulate the SRBs and it works great with FAR the Aries works with it.

https://www.dropbox.com/s/hb51rhkgdz814nl/Engine%20Thrust%20Controll%20V2.zip

Also I have RPM installed and all of the IVAs are blank? RPM says it works with American Pack but I still don't have IVAs

Bobcat had is own RPM's look in KSP/GameData/BobCatind/HOME2/Props/HOMEMFD60x20.

How does it work? It comes with no instructions, and I can't find this plugin anywhere else. Does it allow to change SRB thrust mid flight? If so that's not realistic. Yes, the Shuttle's SRBs varied their thrust along the flight, reducing it during the critical Max Q phase, but that was prepared during manufacture. It wasn't done at the push of a button.

How does it work? It comes with no instructions, and I can't find this plugin anywhere else. Does it allow to change SRB thrust mid flight? If so that's not realistic. Yes, the Shuttle's SRBs varied their thrust along the flight, reducing it during the critical Max Q phase, but that was prepared during manufacture. It wasn't done at the push of a button.

Exactly thats what it does. It varies the power of the SRBs through out the entire flight. If you right click the srbs during flight it tells you what the percent of thrust the srbs are generating. Also with that plugin the srbs never really go off the fuel burns down to almost zero and the thrust is at 1% so they are basically dead weight and you can jettison them.
Question how do I get the burn damage to work? I remember last time I downloaded it there was reentry damage. Now I right click and it says can toggle burn state but that doesn't even work.

bobcat can you build the constellation lander stage first? if you have the time for it to do.

further can you build a texture reduxtion pack for american pack, my macbook doesnt like high textures
Use Active Texture Manager, or just turn down textures in KSP settings. It's very easy, you know?
haha now i know thanx
Got an idea for the American pack, a Starbucks module for space stations, possibly even a Taco Bell module!!!!

Ok, I have a few complaints, entirely centered around the Buran manipulator. I know it is designed to move objects, and I have seen people use it for it's intended purpose, but I can never actually get it to move anything. All the controls lock out the moment it magnetizes. Is there something I'm missing here? Whatever it grabs becomes part of the shuttle, and won't undock from it after, either
